g.title: leaf_10
g.text: A Codex is currently a directory in our Orb-style format.

g.title: leaf_12
g.text: We're trying to work our way into a proper database.

g.title: leaf_29
g.text: - docs: Array keyed by full path name of file, and the spun-up Doc as

g.title: leaf_31
g.text: - files: Array keyed by full path name of file, and a string of the read file
as the value. I think. #todo check

g.title: leaf_33
g.text: - srcs: Array keyed by Path of file, and a string of the knit
source files. This might also be a File; God what a mess.

g.title: leaf_35
g.text: - bytecodes: Array indexted by Path of file, value is a string that is a dump
of the bytecode of the compiled sorcery.

g.title: leaf_47
g.text: for file changes. Only present when

g.title: leaf_61
g.text: - orb: The deck containing the source Orb files.

g.title: leaf_63
g.text: - src: The deck containing the knit src files.

g.title: leaf_65
g.text: - lib: The deck containing the lib files. #NB: In the process of phasing this
out in favor of a database of modules.

g.title: leaf_67
g.text: - srcLib: The deck which is just a symlink of lib and I don't know what I was
thinking when I thought this was a good idea. JFC.

g.title: leaf_78
g.text: The spin step is passed through to the Orb deck.

g.title: leaf_80
g.text: This needs to generalize on a per-file basis.

g.title: leaf_82
g.text: Currently spinning just loads files into the Deck(s).

g.title: leaf_99
g.text: local orbDir, srcDir, libDir, srcLibDir = nil, nil, nil, nil
for i, sub in ipairs(dir.subdirs) do
for j, subsub in ipairs(sub.subdirs) do
if orbDir and srcDir and libDir and srcLibDir then

g.title: leaf_98
g.text: Puts together a codex for a given project

g.title: leaf_108
g.text: Makes a codex given a directory, in string or Path form.

g.title: leaf_113
g.text: corresponding to the root of the project. Wish me luck.
